text: Russian Railways Cup () was an annual pre-season football tournament, held in Moscow and hosted by FC Lokomotiv Moscow. The first edition of the tournament took place in 2007. Dutch club PSV Eindhoven won the title after beating Real Madrid 2–1 in the final. PSV Eindhoven beat Italian team Milan 4–3 on penalties after a goalless draw, in the first semi-final, while Real Madrid managed to come back from two goals down after the first half to beat the hosts Lokomotiv Moscow 5–2. In the third place playoff, Milan scored twice in the last ten minutes to draw with Lokomotiv Moscow 3–3. The Italians went on to claim the third place after beating the Russian club 5–4 on penalties. ==Russian Railways Cup (2007–2008)== {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%; width: 100%; text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2 width=5%|Year !colspan=3|Final !colspan=3|Third Place Match |- !width=15%|Winners !width=8%|Score !width=15%|Runners-up !width=15%|Third place !width=8%|Score !width=15%|Fourth place |- |2007 | PSV Eindhoven |2-1 | Real Madrid | Milan |3–3 aet (5–4) ps | Lokomotiv Moscow |- |2008 | Sevilla |3–0 | Lokomotiv Moscow | Chelsea |5–0 | Milan |- |} *Key: **aet — after extra time **ps — penalty shootout Russian Railways Cup trophy. ==See also== *Amsterdam Tournament *Emirates Cup *Peace Cup *Barclays Asia Trophy ==External links== *Official website Category:Sports competitions in Moscow Category:Defunct international club association football competitions in Europe Category:Russian football friendly trophies
title: Russian Railways Cup
